body.name: Enfamil Reguline Baby Formula, Milk-Based Infant Nutrition, Dual Prebiotics for Soft, Comfortable Stools within 1 Week of Use, Omega-3 DHA for Immune Support, Reusable Powder Tub, 78 Oz​
features: 💩 COMFORT IN 1 WEEK: Dual-prebiotics, proven to help promote softer stools and ease occasional constipation within the first week of use.​
🧠 NURTURING BRAIN DEVELOPMENT: Our formula has expert-recommended DHA, known to support your baby's growing brain, supporting their milestones with confidence.
💧 IMMUNE-SUPPORTING NUTRIENTS: Enfamil Reguline has a blend of vitamins and that help support your little one’s immune system, easy-to-digest proteins, and 30 total nutrients for their development.
🍼 PEACE OF MIND NUTRITION: Designed with care for babies up to 12 months, so you can feel confident in providing your baby with a formula that supports their digestive comfort and overall well-being.
👨🏽‍⚕️ TRUSTED BY PARENTS & PEDIATRICIANS*: Enfamil is the #1 Trusted Infant Formula Brand By Pediatricians* & Parents and the #1 Pediatrician Recommended Brand for Brain-Building & Immune Support.​
SNAP ELIGIBLE: Eligible to be purchased with Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) benefits
body.description: Enfamil Reguline Constipation baby formula with iron features a blend of probiotics and easy to digest proteins to promote soft, comfortable stools. For those times when your baby is struggling to poop, because no one is happy then. It is gentle so it can be used everyday to provide complete nutrition for your little one through 12 months of age. Help ease those hard to go scenarios and make her more comfortable with Enfamil Reguline. *Proven in Enfamil Infant Formula **QuintilesIMS, using the ProVoice Survey fielded from Janurary 2017 to December 31, 2017.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Frequently Asked Questions What is this formula for? Enfamil Reguline is designed to help ease your little one’s occasional constipation, promoting softer stools within the first week of use. Why is DHA so important? Enfamil Reguline has expert-recommended omega 3 DHA, known to support your baby's growing brain and eyes. What are the dual-prebiotics? Our dual prebiotic blend consists of galacto-oligosaccharides (GOS) and polydextrose. This blend of prebiotics is designed to help support your baby’s digestive health and help promote softer, more comfortable stools. Does this help with gassiness? While Enfamil reguline is not specifically for tummy discomfort, it’s specially designed to help soften stools for babies with occasional constipation in as little as one week. We offer an assortment of solutions formulas for all of your little one's needs. To learn more, see the comparison chart below.

Enfamil Reguline Enfamil NeuroPro Gentlease Enfamil A.R. Enfamil Sensitive Enfamil NeuroPro Infant Key Benefit Dual Prebiotic Blend for Softer Stools in 1 Week* and Vitamins and Minerals for Immune Support, has Brain Building DHA Relief from Fussiness, Crying, Gas & Spit-Up and has Brain Building DHA & MFGM Components, HuMO6* Gentle Immune Blend Added Rice Starch to Reduce Frequent Spit-Up in 1 Week* and has Brain Building DHA For Tummies Sensitive to Lactose and has Brain Building DHA, 2'-FL HMO for Immune Support Brain Building DHA & MFGM Components, HuMO6* Immune Blend Brain Building DHA ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ For Fussiness, Crying, Gas & Spit-Up ✓ For Frequent Spit-Up ✓ For Lactose Sensitivity ✓ Easy-to-Digest Proteins ✓ ✓ ✓ Immune Support Dual prebiotics PDX and GOS *2'-FL-HMO¶, PDX, GOS, vit C & E, selenium, partially hydrolyzed protein, reduced lactose Dual prebiotics PDX and GOS 2'-FL HMO *2'-FL-HMO¶, PDX, GOS, vit C & E, and selenium MFGM Components‡ ✓ ✓

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Our baby struggled with hard poop when she was only a few weeks old and would strain, cry, and was generally unhappy on Enfamil gentleease. We had her on Nutramigen for several months and then tried to make the switch back to gentle ease due to the smell and cost of Nutramigen and the fact that she didn’t like the taste. We immediately had the same constipation issues and I tried Reguline as a last ditch effort and within a day my baby had softer poop! I wished that my pediatrician would have recommended it when we were first struggling with her as a newborn! It can be harder to find and doesn’t have the nice refill boxes to save on plastic, but I’ve been so happy that we have a non-stinky formula that our baby likes and tolerates so well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This formula was a game changer for my baby (and for my sanity). A few weeks after he was born he started having trouble passing a bowel movement. He would grunt and cry all day and night. It came down to where we wasn’t going at all unless I helped him go. We tried Gentlease and probiotic drops with no luck. His pediatrician recommended that we try this as a last resort and WOW. I noticed a difference almost immediately. He went from having no bowel movements (on his own) in an day to having 3 a day by himself. We will be using this formula until he no longer needs formula it’s THAT AMAZING.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Baby is happy!
reviews.reviewText: We had to change formula because it was causing constipation in our baby. I found this and she has started going regularly, no more constipation and our baby has been so happy and started sleeping through the night using this. Highly recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2023
reviews.reviewText: After having my baby on Nutramigen for a long time he became constipated. I mean painful pushes with a little blood. He would cry and strain. We switched to this and after a week he was doing much better. Softer passings and no more crying!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Holy crap, this formula works!
reviews.reviewText: This formula is amazing. We had our 3 month old on similac pro advance and Kirkland pro care brands. She was so fussy and gassy and would go 2-3 days without pooping. She would strain, grunt, arch her back, turn red and just couldn’t poop. She even struggled to pass gas. When she did poop it was the consistency of clay, not good. We have been on this formula for a week, after the first day we have seen regular poops. Sometimes twice a day. She also seems MUCH happier not having to strain all the time to poop and pass gas.I would highly recommend this formula to any parents with babies having similar issues. I was hesitant at first since sometimes these things are just marketing ploys, not here. This is amazing formula and has made me a believer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Finally a Happy Baby!
reviews.reviewText: Our 6 month old has had tummy trouble from the beginning. She’s been on several formulas and we’d finally stuck with Similac Pro-Sensitive as it had the least side effects on her.... until about 4 months. She began getting constipated and having bowel obstructions. The poor thing could not poop by herself. We had to help her. She was in so much pain and nothing we did really made much of a difference. We tried Mommy’s Bliss Constipation Relief, prunes, Apple juice, tummy massages, bicycle legs, probiotics, warms baths... you name it.It wasn’t until we decided to invest in this formula that our sweet baby had relief. She started making regular bowel movements within ONE day. She has been on it for about two weeks now and we’ve seen a dramatic improvement in her mood and eating habits. So grateful for this formula. It’s amazing!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The answer for constipated babies
reviews.reviewText: If your baby is constipated and you have ruled other things out like not enough fiber in diet.. you have to switch formulas. You can mix formulas to slowly get the baby used to the new one.. We had to start with 1 and three fourth of the old formula and 1/4 of reguline.. slowly increasing the amount of reguline and decreasing the old formula with each feed until she would take just reguline. This solved her issue with constipation.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Much Better For Regular Bowels
reviews.reviewText: Our 6 month old has been having a lot of trouble having regular BMs over the last month or so, so much so that we had resorted to enimas every 4th day or so just to relieve the pressure that was building up in his system. We were using gentle ease formula as our son was a little gassy and spits up on a regular basis. We have tried everything else (with drs permission of course), Karo syrup, pear juice, and even miralax each day with no relief.We were commonly seeing what we referred to as a plug, a piece of poop stuck in his rectum, that he just couldn't get out. He would push and push and cry in pain, well I am happy to say that after 2 weeks of this new formula he is having a dirty diaper at least every other day and it is very soft and easy to pass.We saw no gassy side effects, stomach gurgled a bit but he didn't seem to mind it
